required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study for Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Phase II, Multicenter, Open-label Trial Evaluating the Activity and Tolerability of FK228 in Patients With Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma That is Progressive Following or During Immunotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the activity of FK228 in metastatic renal cell carcinoma (RCC) patients who have developed progressive disease (PD) following or during treatment with immunotherapy.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the rate of objective response (the best response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR)).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of disease control, Complete Response, Partial Response, or Stable Disease
Number of Participants with Adverse Events
Change from screening assessment to the final study visit in Karnofsky performance status.

intervention.description: Patients receive 13 mg/m2 of romidepsin (FK228) intravenously over 4 hours on Days 1, 8, and 15 of each 28-day cycle.

facility.name: City of Hope National Medical Center
